14528.text: recognise and identify their own emotions

14551.text: identify a range of emotions and describe situations that may evoke these emotions

14561.text: compare their emotional responses with those of their peers

14578.text: describe the influence that people, situations and events have on their emotions

14590.text: explain how the appropriateness of emotional responses influences behaviour

14605.text: examine influences on and consequences of their emotional responses in a learning, social and work-related contexts

14623.text: reflect critically on their emotional responses to challenging situations in a wide range of learning, social and work-related contexts

14549.text: identify their likes and dislikes, needs and wants, and explore what influences these

14555.text: identify and describe personal interests, skills and achievements and explain how these contribute to family and school life

14580.text: describe personal strengths and challenges and identify skills they wish to develop

14586.text: describe the influence that personal qualities and strengths have on their learning outcomes

14611.text: make a realistic assessment of their abilities and achievements, and prioritise areas for improvement

14629.text: assess their strengths and challenges and devise personally appropriate strategies to achieve future success

14534.text: select tasks they can do in different learning contexts

14550.text: identify their abilities, talents and interests as learners

14554.text: discuss their strengths and weaknesses as learners and identify some learning strategies to assist them

14582.text: identify and describe factors and strategies that assist their learning

14593.text: identify preferred learning styles and work habits

14609.text: identify and choose a range of learning strategies appropriate to specific tasks and describe work practices that assist their learning

14622.text: evaluate the effectiveness of commonly used learning strategies and work practices and refine these as required

14527.text: recognise and identify participation in or completion of a task

14541.text: reflect on their feelings as learners and how their efforts affect skills and achievements

14558.text: reflect on what they have learnt about themselves from a range of experiences at home and school

14576.text: reflect on personal strengths and achievements, based on self-assessment strategies and teacher feedback

14597.text: monitor their progress, seeking and responding to feedback from teachers to assist them in consolidating strengths, addressing weaknesses and fulfilling their potential

14603.text: predict the outcomes of personal and academic challenges by drawing on previous problem solving and decision making strategies and feedback from peers and teachers

14632.text: reflect on feedback from peers, teachers and other adults, to analyse personal characteristics and skill set that contribute to or limit their personal and social capability

14531.text: recognise and identify how their emotions influence the way they feel and act

14538.text: express their emotions constructively in interactions with others

14562.text: describe ways to express emotions to show awareness of the feelings and needs of others

14583.text: identify and describe strategies to manage and moderate emotions in increasingly unfamiliar situations

14599.text: explain the influence of emotions on behaviour, learning and relationships

14602.text: forecast the consequences of expressing emotions inappropriately and devise measures to regulate behaviour

14625.text: consider control and justify their emotional responses, in expressing their opinions, beliefs, values, questions and choices

14532.text: make a choice to participate in a class activity

14539.text: follow class routines to assist learning

14553.text: set goals in learning and personal organisation by completing tasks within a given time

14581.text: explain the value of self-discipline and goal-setting in helping them to learn

14585.text: analyse factors that influence ability to self-regulate; devise and apply strategies to monitor own behaviour and set realistic learning goals

14608.text: select, use and analyse strategies that assist in regulating behaviour and achieving personal and learning goals

14627.text: critically analyse self-discipline strategies and personal goals and consider their application in social and work-related contexts

14529.text: attempt tasks with support or prompting

14547.text: attempt tasks independently and identify when and from whom help can be sought

14556.text: work independently on routine tasks and experiment with strategies to complete other tasks where appropriate

14579.text: consider, select and adopt a range of strategies for working independently and taking initiative

14589.text: assess the value of working independently, and taking initiative to do so where appropriate

14606.text: critique their effectiveness in working independently by identifying enablers and barriers to achieving goals

14626.text: establish personal priorities, manage resources effectively and demonstrate initiative to achieve personal goals and learning outcomes

14530.text: identify people and situations with which they feel a sense of familiarity or belonging

14537.text: identify situations that feel safe or unsafe, approaching new situations with confidence

14557.text: undertake and persist with short tasks, within the limits of personal safety

14569.text: persist with tasks when faced with challenges and adapt their approach where first attempts are not successful

14595.text: devise strategies and formulate plans to assist in the completion of challenging tasks and the maintenance of personal safety

14612.text: assess, adapt and modify personal and safety strategies and plans, and revisit tasks with renewed confidence

14619.text: evaluate, rethink and refine approaches to tasks to take account of unexpected or difficult situations and safety considerations

14535.text: show an awareness for the feelings, needs and interests of others

14545.text: acknowledge that people hold many points of view

14563.text: describe similarities and differences in points of view between themselves and people in their communities

14570.text: discuss the value of diverse perspectives and describe a point of view that is different from their own

14592.text: explain how means of communication differ within and between communities and identify the role these play in helping or hindering understanding of others

14613.text: acknowledge the values, opinions and attitudes of different groups within society and compare to their own points of view

14618.text: articulate their personal value system and analyse the effects of actions that repress social power and limit the expression of diverse views

14543.text: describe ways they can help at home and school

14560.text: describe how they contribute to their homes, classrooms and local communities, and how others care for and assist them

14574.text: identify the various communities to which they belong and what they can do to make a difference

14598.text: identify a community need or problem and consider ways to take action to address it

14604.text: analyse personal and social roles and responsibilities in planning and implementing ways of contributing to their communities

14621.text: plan, implement and evaluate ways of contributing to civil society at local, national regional and global levels

14546.text: explore relationships through play and group experiences

14564.text: identify ways to care for others, including ways of making and keeping friends

14577.text: describe factors that contribute to positive relationships, including with people at school and in their community

14588.text: identify the differences between positive and negative relationships and ways of managing these

14601.text: identify indicators of possible problems in relationships in a range of social and work related situations

14617.text: explain how relationships differ between peers, parents, teachers and other adults, and identify the skills needed to manage different types of relationships

14536.text: respond to the feelings, needs and interests of others

14540.text: identify positive ways to initiate, join and interrupt conversations with adults and peers

14565.text: discuss the use of verbal and nonverbal communication skills to respond appropriately to adults and peers

14571.text: identify communication skills that enhance relationships for particular groups and purposes

14600.text: identify and explain factors that influence effective communication in a variety of situations

14614.text: analyse enablers of and barriers to effective verbal, nonverbal and digital communication

14631.text: formulate plans for effective communication (verbal, nonverbal, digital) to complete complex tasks

14548.text: share experiences of cooperation in play and group activities

14559.text: identify cooperative behaviours in a range of group activities

14584.text: describe characteristics of cooperative behaviour and identify evidence of these in group activities

14587.text: contribute to groups and teams, suggesting improvements in methods used for group investigations and projects

14607.text: assess the extent to which individual roles and responsibilities enhance group cohesion and the achievement of personal and group objectives

14630.text: critique their ability to devise and enact strategies for working in diverse teams, drawing on the skills and contributions of team members to complete complex tasks

14552.text: identify options when making decisions to meet their needs and the needs of others

14567.text: practise individual and group decision making in situations such as class meetings and when working in pairs and small groups

14573.text: contribute to and predict the consequences of group decisions in a range of situations

14594.text: identify factors that influence decision making and consider the usefulness of these in making their own decisions

14616.text: assess individual and group decision-making processes in challenging situations

14624.text: develop and apply criteria to evaluate the outcomes of individual and group decisions and analyse the consequences of their decision making

14542.text: listen to others’ ideas, and recognise that others may see things differently from them

14568.text: practise solving simple interpersonal problems, recognising there are many ways to solve conflict

14575.text: identify a range of conflict resolution strategies to negotiate positive outcomes to problems

14596.text: identify causes and effects of conflict, and practise different strategies to diffuse or resolve conflict situations

14610.text: assess the appropriateness of various conflict resolution strategies in a range of social and work-related situations

14628.text: generate, apply and evaluate strategies such as active listening, mediation and negotiation to prevent and resolve interpersonal problems and conflicts

14544.text: identify ways to take responsibility for familiar tasks at home and school

14566.text: discuss ways in which they can take responsibility for their own actions

14572.text: discuss the concept of leadership and identify situations where it is appropriate to adopt this role

14591.text: initiate or help to organise group activities that address a common need

14615.text: plan school and community projects, applying effective problem-solving and team-building strategies, and making the most of available resources to achieve goals

14620.text: propose, implement and monitor strategies to address needs prioritised at local, national, regional and global levels, and communicate these widely
